reviewText:
I agree with reviewer Jerry Hunt. I love the Fractured Fairy Tales themselves; they were my favorite part of Rocky and Bullwinkle when I was growing up, and that's saying a lot. I put this DVD on my wish list and was thrilled to receive it for Christmas.

The stories are as gloriously crazy as I remembered (though I had not remembered how minimal the animation is). And it's a huge treat to watch one after another of them!

HOWEVER, having to sit through a REQUIRED, LONG commercial at the beginning makes this DVD a huge disappointment to me. I will not (as I was imagining) watch it over and over again. I will watch it maybe twice, and then it's going right into the recycle bin.

If it were not for the introductory commercial which cannot be bypassed or fast-forwarded through, my rating would be five stars rather than two. I am really tempted to give only one because of this design item which makes the DVD pretty much worthless as far as I'm concerned.

Huge disappointment.

These are 5-star television comedy cartoons (not great animation, just great comedy). HOWEVER, if you already own the Rocky & Bullwinkle season sets you already have these. The number is the Fractured Fairy Tale sequence number, not the aired episode number. From Rocky & Bullwinkle Season 1 3) Rapunzel 6) The Brave Little Tailor 7) Rumpelstiltskin 14) Cinderella 15) Snow White 18) Pinocchio 22) Cinderella Returns From Rocky & Bullwinkle Season 2 19) Ridinghoods Anonymous 20) Sleeping Beauty 36) The Ugly Duckling 31) Rumpelstiltskin Returns 27) Leaping Beauty 40) The Enchanted Frog 25) The Pied Piper 32) The Magic Fish Order seasons 1 & 2 here: Rocky & Bullwinkle & Friends - The Complete First Season Rocky & Bullwinkle & Friends - The Complete Second Season
Hilariously funny.  Glad this finally came out on DVD.  Brings back fond memories of Saturday mornings.
Just like I remembered. What a kick to hear the music and see the fondly remembered cartoons.  Can't wait to get #2.

This is a great DVD. My toddler children love watching it as well as the whole family from parents, grandparents and even great grandparents. The stories are written with humor. My children will grow up knowing the Fractured Fair Tales version of Snow White before the Disney version. This is a good thing in my opinion. I will definitely look for Vol 2 when it becomes available.

What a wondrous revivial of a simpler and more joyous life!  I've begun sharing the episodes with grandchldren (ages 4, 6, and 8).  It's a grand discussion after a viewing!  Each has a different "take" on their perception of the underlying themes.  From "cute and funny" to "members of Anonymous groups should be respected."  And we have been able to skip the trailers.  Would like to see a return of the "Aesop's Fables."

It is good in this fallen world that occasionally something becomes available that reminds us of a better time.  I only pray that more volumes will be released in time.  There is not one fractured fairy tale that is not worth reviving.

Fractured Fairy Tales are not only fantastic classic toons, but they're also great for use in a high school english classroom to illustrate narrative elements! Pair it with the companion book (Fractured Fairy Tales, A.J. Jacobs) with 25 tales for even more fun. I just purchased this disc from Amazon and have enjoyed rewatching these great shorts from my childhood. I couldn't find a list of the included episodes anywhere before purchasing, so here's the rundown in case you're wondering too! The disk includes these 15 episodes:

* Rapunzel
* The Brave Little Tailor
* Rumpelstiltskin
* Cinderella
* Snow White
* Sleeping Beauty
* Pinocchio
* Ridinghoods Anonymous
* The Ugly Duckling
* Cinderella Returns
* Rumpelstiltskin Returns
* Leaping Beauty
* The Enchanted Frog
* The Pied Piper
* The Magic Fish

The disk also has some nifty Bullwinkle puppet intros as a bonus, as well as a cute case and menu theme.

If you're reading this, you know the Jay Ward's Fractured Fairy Tales are terrific and funny.  Unfortunately, this compilation disk is flawed.  The VERY irritating menu demands that you sit through too horrible trailers for terrible kid's movies before you can get to the main menu.  They won't even fast forward or skip to main menu.  Why would Sony insist on this very Disney-like irritation.  What would Jay Ward think?  This disk is for collector's, not brain-dead children who want to watch "Frosty the Sequel".  The disk also has menu problems once you get to the main menu.  I've contacted Sony and hopefully they will fix the problem.

As a senior daddy, I was very happy that my favorite cartoons when I was five are became my five-year old daughter's favorites. It is still a refreshing blend of child humor and sophisticated wit. Jay Ward managed to interlace a children's show with political humor, adult humor and sardonic satire by turning the scripts in so close to the deadline that network censors didn't have time to review them before they aired. Some think Shrek, Toy Story and The Incredibles are new breed of child comedy with adult jokes-they are not.  Pixar's success is simply producing feature length Jay Ward cartoons with higher production values. And as good as Pixar 's flicks are- Jay Ward's are better. Nell is in love with Dudley's horse, Mr. Peabody is a brilliant dog with a little boy as a pet, Boris Badenoff is indeed bad enough and his slinky femme fatale Natasha is the sexiest bad girl on TV in 1961. Fractured Fables  was narrated by the inimitable Hans Conreid. Conreid will be remembered by many as the reoccuring ace aviator Wrong-way Feldman on Gilligan's Island. His voice is reason enough to watch these tales of Mother goose gone mad. Fractured Fables clearly pre-sage Monty Python in style and mentality and
Witty and filled with silly puns.

Animation from a simpler time in the history of American television entertainment, made by grown-ups, for grown-ups. Rocky and Bullwinkle's animated variety show was cutting edge in the late fifties, and segments such as Fractured Fairy Tales made it a real treat for me.  Now-a-days, I just grab a device to stream from the cloud, ride a time machine through a wave of Cold War nostalgia and awkward civil rights pratfalls. Sweet bliss. Thanks , Amazon.

This series is even funnier than Mr. Peabody and Sherman and the reason is the voice of the great comedy actor, Edward Everett Horton, who
was the narrator. As of of the many excellent actors who played in the Rocky and Bullwinkle show, Mr. Horton had a long history of playing
comedy roles in the movies especially in the 1930s.
To prove my thesis is correct, when you watch Fractured Fairy Tales, turn off the sound for a few minutes, then rewind it and listen to the voice
of Mr. Horton.
I am not sure whether Mr. Horton would be happy to know that most people recognize his voice than his physically acting ability, but I have
a feeling that as long as you enjoyed yourself, he would not mind.

Good old stuff from the 1960's!  From Wikipedia: Rocky & Bullwinkle is known for quality writing and wry humor. Mixing puns, cultural and topical satire, and self-referential humor, it appealed to adults as well as children.

Are you kidding me? It don't get no better than this! Take a collection of your favorite childhood fairy tales, twist them around until they're better than the originals, and throw in Edward Everett Horton to narrate them, and you will be hard-pressed to find a better way to pass away a perfect afternoon. It never ceases to amaze me just how good Jay Ward and friends really were. Rocky and Bullwinkle, Dudley Do-Right of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Boris and Natasha, Mr. Peabody and Sherman, Aesop's Fables, Frostbite Falls, Minnesota, The Way-Back Machine- I'm having a nostalgia attack! If you should ever get the chance to watch this show, or any of the other a fore mentioned CARTOONS, you will not ever be able to watch Sponge Bob, American Dad, Family Guy or anything else of that ilk that passes itself off as the new era of cartoons without realizing just how much a shortage of talent we now have in this genre. It's like comparing "All In The Family" against any of the disgusting array of reality shows that proliferate the air waves. Reality shows are popular with networks because they don't have to hire actors, script writers, or experienced camera operators. The only possible reason I can see for their popularity with viewers is that we haven't seen anything that stimulates our brains in so long, we've lost our ability to appreciate well-written satire. God saves us all!

As a person who grew up with "The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show" in the 50s... at the time, being of an age in the single digits, "Fractured Fairy Tales' as well as all of the other associated show segments, were funny, amusing and watchable.
But now since I've grown up to be a person in their 60s (that is: the year 2015 minus the 1950s = 60ish, give or take) I've had great fun reliving the "Tales" of the past.
The episodes are still funny, amusing and watchable but life and age has made me realize that every thing about the show is "BRILLIANT"!
Everything about the show is/was "BRILLIANT" and far ahead of its time.
I say "was" cause I didn't know what "BRILLIANT" meant in the 50s.
But now I know better.
The writing (especially the writing) and the animation and the music are undeniably awesome!
Too bad it was looked on as a "cartoon series" way back in the day.
It is definitely more than a "cartoon" and people should start re-watching it to see how ahead of it's time it actually was.
Brilliantly creative!
I used to watch this cartoon when I was a kid it was great back then and still is.
They need to do a new series of this. It is old fairy tales with different interpretations. Useful if you know the original stories first.

Watched an episode of Mr. Peabody and Sherman with my 6 and 9 year old grand daughters. Brought back my childhood memories. The girls enjoyed it, but  I could see them furrowing their eyebrows and using body language to say, "Huh?"  We had a good talk after comparing the two versions. It was fun.

I enjoyed these clips on Bullwinkle as a child and now my children enjoy them as well.  They are clever and funny without the cheap gross humor overwhelming kids' TV shows today.  The Fairy Tales are narrated by the wonderful Edward Everett Horton, and while the animation is obviously dated, these shorts are really a absolute treasure.
Such wit and cleverness is sadly lacking in today's television.  If this doesn't make you smile, I don't know what would.  I only wish there were more to watch.  50 years old and still great?  Wow.

Although this was created many years ago it remains as much fun to watch as it was then.  The voice of the late Edward Everett Horton is very distinctive and makes these presentations even more enjoyable.

Really enjoy almost every single one of these "Fractured Fairy Tales"...It's a good thing that they made these back in the 60's because if they made them now, they would be SO PC, it would ruin them for everyone...
I love it. I love it. It really works great. Glad I purchased it. Shopping was easy. Movie was clear and colorful.
I used to watch these as a kids when I was growing up... now my kids get to watch this sill episodes too.  We have a great time laughing at the stories.
I loved these as a kid and now watching them with my kids, they're even funnier.  The jokes go over their heads mostly, but that makes it more fun for the adults.  So quick-witted and hilarious.
Classic!! It's still funny and well done after all these years. We have quoted them and referred to them over and over.
Hilarious !  Brings back many, many warm memories.  They do not make them like this any more.  I loved it.

Preparing myself to see Mr Peabody and Sherman so started with the fractured fairy tales.  Every bit as funny and sick as they were decades ago.  Plan to look at some of the old Mr Peabodys too.  Really fun stuff!!
When I was young, Fractured Fairy Tales was my favorite part of the Rocky & Bullwinkle show.  It's still fun to watch and I'm happy it's part of my amazon instant prime videos!
I like to watch this because it puts a funny spin on fairy tales. It reminds me of when I was a child. Good to watch after a crazy day,
It's fun to watch these again, it feels like the first time since I don't remember the storyline changes or the jokes and puns. Enjoyed the series. Really like the artwork and colors.
Takes me back to my childhood. Couldn't wait for this to come on during Rocky & Bullwinkle show. Good times!
Brings back a lot of memories fRom my childhood. Funny, smart and timeless.  I share it with my daughter.  She loves.
I laughed and laughed at these re-telling of fairy tales I've known all my life. Edward Everett Horton did a great job of narrating these stories. This is pure recreation.
Extremely creative writing.  Never sure where the strory will take you.  Highly recommended for all ages. Wish more had been produced.
It is always fun to watch cartoons from the past. Love the oldies, can't wait to watch more of these great cartoons.

We read the original stories in all episodes, and really enjoyed seeing how they were fractured!  Wish there were more programming
like this being produced today.
This show is just like I remember it and was very cute.  You get 3 cartoons per episode.  Very funny.
Takes me back in the days when I used to watch as a kid. Still entertaining...still enjoy it. Introducing my grandkids to it.

Fun to the share the shorts with the grandkids.  Still smile at the comedy on many different levels.
Editing is a bit choppy
Watched this as part of the Bullwinkle and Rocky show.  Laughed as a child, still laugh at them.  It wouldn't have worked without Edward Everette Horton being the story teller.
I downloaded supposedly for my grand children ( but also for myself ).  I was wonderful hearing Edward Everett Horton's voice again narrating these updated ( to the early 1960s ) fairy tales.
LOVED WATCHING THESE AS A CHILD, I STILL LOVE WATCHING THEM TODAY. I WOULD LIKE TO SEE MORE OF THESE.

Simple enough for a child to love...and I did as a kid as these were part of the Rocky and Bullwinkle show.
Lots of in-jokes for the times for Adults too....and that's why I STILL Love them.
If you don't enjoy this warped cartoon show then I can't help you. Bizarre and familiar if you saw it as a kid.
With the resurgence of Sherman and Mr. Peabody, it was fun to watch one of my favorite cartoons.  They don't make them like they used to.
Must see to relax.  I really enjoy watching to unwind.  Watching the old type of cartoons are very relaxing and enjoyable.

It's a treat to be able to watch these episodes, which I recall fondly from my own childhood, with my two young kids. They are both fairy tale fanatics and I think that must be what keeps them interested, as many of the wonderfully awful puns and showbiz lingo go right over their heads. I think they get a kick out of seeing the tales they know so well turned on their heads. If you're a fan of Jay Ward and all the wonderful writers and voice talent he worked with, you already know how great these shows are!
This is from my mother's generation that she shared with me. Now I can share it with my children. They find it quite amusing
Very cute! The stories reminded me of my childhood!  A bowl of Lucky Charms, my favorite stuffed animals and my Fairytales!

It is helpful to be familiar with the fairy tale in its original form.  They are a charming presentation of close to the original tale, with some tweaks and comments thrown in - some reflect popular culture, some just fun silliness.  Children would enjoy.  Adults who enjoy childlike entertainment, peppered with a few "in jokes" should also enjoy.
In my youth this was my most beloved cartoon. I love the way the man with the mustauche sweeps up in the beginning.
Great lines, imaginative embellishment on bedtime stories and designed for adults as well as kids...Now I need to catch up on Rocky and Bullwinkle.
I had to baby sit my sister and made her watch these cartoons! They are still just as cute as ever'
This was my favorite part of the Rocky and Bullwinkle and was happy to find they can still make me laugh!
Slightly cynical but very humorous take on the fairy tales of old... This is especially true of the closing 'moral' to the story
Short stories great just before putting kids to sleep, but enough humor to entertain adults. Wish had Rocky and Bullwinkle episodes
Sharing these with my granddaughter and she loves them as much as I did and do! We love the entire Rocky and Bulkinkle and friends.

These are great! Enjoyed them all over again.  Now will show to my grandkids.
Hope they think they are just as funny.
This 1st set of Fractured Fairytales carries my husband and I back to a simpler time. Our childhood. Funny smart and entertaining. Thank you Amazon.
They are the same stories we all know just funny, so it makes my daughter pay closer attention and she finds it funny

I remembered these from my childhood and loved them.  I'm using them to introduce fairy tales to my kids and spark their creativity by looking at life, ideas, and literature from a different point of view.
These segments were originally part of the "Rock and Bullwinkle Show." It's a little dated, but it's good nostalgic fun. My seven year old said it was funny, but it looked old.
My daughter loves watching them! They are the classic, old school cartoons. We have watched them numerous times in the past few days!
I remembered seeing these as a kid and I think we liked them, but trying to watch now with my kids just seems like it's drivel...and they don't need any more of that.

Thank you Amazon once again. Hopefully your library will expand even more with so many cartoons of yesterday.
Truly appreciate your job well done!
Classic cartoon history.  Just as funny as the first day they were broadcast.  You MUST WATCH!!  Quotable puns work in every life situation -- just ask my co-workers.
Brings back fond memories... Great for the children to see what old cartoons daddy used to watch when he was a child.

I love these shows. I have a lot of health problems. So I don't get to get out a lot except for doctor visits. I have good and bad days. Any time I am having a bad day or need a little lift me up. I turn to these shows. I loved Rocky and the fairy tales were one of my favorites. I also loved Dudley do right and Mr. Peabody the dog who owned the boy. I would love to see more added to the prime stream.
I love these little stories. The cartoon artistry is excellent and unique. Why don't they make them like this now.
I am 62 years old and loved the Rocky show so much. I was so pleased to see that there is a way to still see the best of all animated cartoons was still availaable to watch. Too much Fun!
these are excerpts of the Rocky and Bullwinkle show that I grew up with.  They still work today and they are still funny to me.

The "Fractured Fairytales" was an add on.  I was trying to get $25.00 worth of stuff so that I could get the super savers shipping discount.  I saw this DVD. I all of a sudden remembered my sister and I recently talking about, how we use to love the fractured fairy tales, that came on after  the Sherman and Mr. Peabody show,  it was perfect timing and the price was right.
I bought this for my grand kids, so when they visit we can watch decent cartoons and laugh together. I hate these modern cartoons of today; they suck
Brings back a lot of memories.  My granchildren had never seen them and liked watching them.  Very accessable and easy to watch.
Always loved these "tales" as a kid.  Watched them again at age 50 with niece, who is 9, she loved them as much as I did.  Wants her own copy for B'day.  Who says kids these days have no taste.
So glad these are available for purchase for those of us who do not have Prime, the quality is great!
Great stories , I watched in my youth and are still funny today, waiting for volume two. and You  don't have to time Rocky&Bullwinkle to see.
Fractured is the word and rightly so, for some of the best cartoons ever made!  I grew up with Rocky and friends many moons ago, and I'll never forget them.
This is from years ago when we only had black and white TV.  Is great to show our grandchildren, they get a good laugh from it.
These cartoon shorts bring back many memories.  My daughter loves as well.  I would recommend these to anyone with kids.

My daughters loved the inventive stories that come from this series.
The charters from these stories are very colorful. I highly recommend this cartoon to your viewers.
Unable to watch. I just got this device, its probably operator error, but other shows work fine. I will have to try again
I loved these when I was a kid and was thrilled when I saw them on prime!  They crack me up more now that I know what they mean!
Intelligent humor. Quirky fun.  Loved them as a kid, appreciate them even more now.  Hard to watch without cracking a smile. Or even laughing out loud. Old-style.
So creative, for children and adults both, highly recommended for people of any age, reading level, preferred type of humor, etc.!
These are all too close to real life, but better.  So much better than the original fairy tales.  Will continue to collect them all.
Very fun to see my kids loving this as much as I did when it was on tv! Not always sure it's appropriate for the 3 year old, but the 6 year old can watch it all day long.
I actually selected this to introduce these little cartoons to my teenage son...a little humor from my youth. I obviously enjoyed them more than he did.
I loved these growing up and now my daughter and I watch them together. They show their age a bit but they are still very entertaining.
I used to watch these as a kid so it was a trip down memory lane to watch them again.  Always enjoyable!!
When cartoons were watchable by anybody that wanted a laugh. They are better to me now than when I first watched them almost fifty years ago.

When I was young I thought this show was really funny but now it just seems silly. The plots make no sense even for spoofs. Example: One story is about A commoner who becomes a war hero because he carries around a rotten fish that causes the enemy to surrender just to be rid of him. Some may find it funny but it's not for me.

Many of these were taken from the later "Bullwinkle Show" and are not as funny as their earlier versions, but it's fun to enjoy all the parodies and caricatures that we missed when we were kids. The best part is of course, Edward Everett Horton as narrator. Always loved the sound of his voice, and the fact that he narrates so seriously makes these episodes even funnier. Take a romp through a fairyland from the "other side".
Fun, but not as fun as I remembered.  That's all I have to say about Volume 1. Sorry about that.

If you remember these, you'll look forward in seeing them here. If you haven't; you'll want to watch these cute little cartoon spins on some tales, & you probably won't understand my title.

The DVD is fine, plays well & the shows are crisp & clear. I had thought a couple seemed edited, & someone else had too. Even if they were, it doesn't take away from the shows. I'm sure kids will still enjoy these (as with most cartoons, they weren't made for kids really).
Fractured Fairy Tales is an excellent and timely revision of time-worn fairy tales. No one is too old for Fractured Fairy Tales. The droll stories are entertaining for the whole family.
Excellent/New Condition. Wonderful chance to revisit an enduring favorite for the character voices and twisted/hip take on classic fairy tales.

Such a different perspective watching as an adult!  I bought this for my 4 & 6 year old girls, and watching it with them is really fun.  They get some of the quirky because they know the fairy tales, but some of the innuendo is lost on them - for now at least!  Funny thing is I heard them playing the other day and talking about "the contract" which is a reoccurring theme.  They don't miss much!  Of the 3 I ordered - Tennessee Tuxedo, Peabody & Sherman and Fractured Fairy Tales, I'd have to say this is the favourite at the moment.
i totally enjoy the old shows.  ordered and received this item in excellant time.  completely pleased with the purchasing process...
If you remember the Fractured Fairy Tales featured during Rocky and Bullwinkle, you'll love the 15 tales on this dvd.  Brings back lots of happy memories.

A cool little trip down memory lane. I remember seeing these during the Rocky n Bullwinkle show as a kid so bought them for nostalgic reasons.  They are not as funny or entertaining as I remember... but still a cool little piece for my cartoon collection.  If you have little ones... they would probably get a kick out of them too.

Why has this taken so long just to get it out the door and ship it?

Why has this taken so long just to get it out the door and ship it?
I haven't seen fractured fairy tales for nearly 50 years so when I saw it available from Amazon I had to have them. Very entertaining.
This is a great 1960 cartoon! For those hanckering for a cartoon before the modern world and CG killed cartoons, this is a good one!
These were great!  I remember watching them as part of the Rocky & Bullwinkle show as a kid after school.  For some reason, I like the simple animation, and the voice characterizations are hilarious.

Loved the DVD Played excellent. I love all nostalga expecially the cartoons and Super Fantasy such as all the comic book super heros, and all the Conan or all the barbarian movies, expecially the Hercules and Zena episodes.
Everything is distastefully insane. Not funny, illogical, and no point at all. Just stupid. I don't think Forrest Gump would like it either.
I used these last year after reading the Grimms' versions to my 8th graders. We compared and contrasted using Venn diagrams. They loved it.
I received this movie in a quick timely manner. I was looking forward to sharing it with my grandchildren. Thank you very much.

The packaging was in excellent condition.  The DVD plays perfect.  The cartoons were the exact quality as when I was a young child.  I love them and I was able to share them with my nine year old.  1000 % BETTER than now day cartoons!

Isn't it always about the voice?  It is for me!  Love Edward Everett Hortons naration!! When my kids watched Rocky and Bullwinkle, they were just on, but when Fractured Fairytales came on, I took a seat to watch and enjoy!  I purchased this from Amazon a few years ago, seems like 2 years so it's probably 4 yrs.  The quality is excellent in every way.  Sound is perfect and the view is crisp and faultless.  Thank you whoever did such a great job of reproducing and editing the material.  And thanks Amazon.  Is there anything that can't be found on Amazon?  They're an amazing resource and my "go to" for purchases.  I greatly appreciate them.
I loved every minuet of it and so did my nieces and nephew. these kids have no idea what cartoons were really like. Classic Television.

I actually downloaded this video for my children.  I remember the whole Bullwinkle series fondly, and I remembered the Fractured Fairy Tales as being clever and funny... BUT on viewing it again, I must say that the Tales don't hold up as well as I would have thought.

My children -- who are currently 9 and 11 yo -- were immediately drawn to the voices and images, however they didn't want to view it again.  Bad sign.

I watched them and my response was 'meh'.  The stories were interesting.  I still liked the narrator and idea of the stories but they were not as clever as I remembered.  The plot twists, weren't that twisty.

THE SKINNY:::
Worth watching.  I loved the trip down memory lane and can't wait to watch some of the old Rocky and Bullwinkle shows.

I'm thinking that for today's TV savvy kids, that the Fractured Tales might be more suitable for younger viewers -- 5 to 9 years perhaps.
they were just as entertaining as they were when my husband and i were kids. next generation loved thm too.

I used to watch the syndicated Rocky & Bullwinkle shows and loved the Fractured Fairy Tales, which was my favorite part of the show. The collection here includes a great selection of tales read by the wonderful Edward Everett Horton. His wonderful voice overs helped make the show. While kids may enjoy it, I think adults would enjoy them more for the clever jabs at life that are still funny. These cartoons were part of the rare animation that may have been marketed for kids, but was enjoyed more by adults. They don't make them like this anymore. You do have to sit through some annoying kid previews, but the cartoons are worth it! A must have for your collection.
Just like I remember seeing it when I was a kid. Good for all ages and worth the price.

I was all ready to buy this dvd until I started reading all the negative comments about being forced to watch previews.  Then I got to thinking that the episodes might be on YouTube and I was right.  I watched three and really enjoyed them.  I had fond memories of these from my younger days and I just thought I would pass this information on for any who might want to sample the episodes before purchasing the dvd.
Hasn't it been long enough?  Where's Volume 2?  This one is GREAT but it's not everything.  More please?
I was very excited to receive this in mint condition. I am planning on using it in my Summer Reading Program.

I thoroughly enjoyed this video.  It really brought back memories of childhood Saturday mornings eating a bowl of Cap'n Crisp in front of the TV and watching Rocky and Bullwinkle. I am a typical baby boomer. I always loved hearing Edward Everett Horton's whimsical voice narrate the Fractured Fairy Tales, too!

These cartoons, included with the Rocky and Bulwinkle show are just the best, funniest cartoon ever on tv and even at my age I still laugh at them. Glad I made the purchase of the DVDs. And I recommend buying them via Amazon, as the price is surely the best you will find.

I love the old comics.  Looney tunes, Rocky and Bullwinkle.  This is a great addition to anyones collect of old comics.  I used to wake up at 5 AM every Saturday morning when I was a kid to watch these old comics.  I am glad now I can watch them when I want and relive my childhood!!

This DVD is exactly what I wanted.  I was very hesitant to buy it because of previous reviews regarding the annoying previews.  All you have to do is hit the skip but a couple times to get to the main menu.  I am so glad I bought it and my 8 yr old son likes these wonderful cartoons too.  A great flash back to the early 70's for me!  Take my advice buy it it's well worth the money.

When I was a boy, many long years ago, I used to get home from school in time to watch the original broadcasts of Rocky and Bullwinkle. If memory serves me, it was composed of an episode of a serial featuring the titular heros, an episode of Mr. Peabody or an episode of Fractured Fairy Tales, then another episode of the serial. (For those who discovered R & B in it's incarnation as "The Bullwinkle Show" this was, I believe, before the advent of "Aesop and Son" or "Dudley Do-right"The Best of Dudley Do-Right, Vol. 1.) Although over 40 years old, this collection of 15 cartoons from the original "Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle" Rocky & Bullwinkle & Friends - The Complete First SeasonRocky & Bullwinkle & Friends - The Complete Third SeasonRocky & Bullwinkle & Friends - The Complete Second Seasonshow are still a treat. They possess that delicate balance of wit and silliness that the Jay Ward cartoons were noted for, and along with "Mr. Peabody's Improbable History"The Best of Mr. Peabody & Sherman, Vol. 1, were always one of the spots in the show that I eagerly awaited. This collection is copyrighted 2005 therefore it is possible given the vagaries of the DVD industry that it will not be available much longer. Also while it is labeled Volume 1, I strongly doubt that Volume 2 was ever issued. (It may not have been possible to issue a Volume 2 due to lack of material. However, given that this is touted as the "Best of" one can only assume that there is more in the series that could be released.) I will end this here as "I suddenly feel an overwhelming urge for a salad made of Rampian, a variety of European bell flower. If I can't have it, I will surely die."

These fantastic tales would have been given a five star rating except that all I can say is SHAME ON the distributors who repackaged this collection. How can any marketing guru think that by continually punishing us by forcing us to endure the non related promotional tripe that they attach like a virus in the form of unrelated promos will sell more dvds? Happy? NO. Ready to lynch the people who did this? YES.

I can only assume that these people weren't even born when we first viewed these timeless masterpieces as children and somehow feel threatened by the competition. It's enough to make you hunt down a dvd pirate who could make a copy with just the fractured fairy tales only. That's the only way I can think we will be able to repeatedly watch this dvd minus the opening advertising epics that we certainly didn't pay for.

The material is great, but I can't recommend this DVD because its programming is so irritating.  The viewer is forced to sit through several tedious previews for some truly unimpressive children's videos.  Attempting to fast forward or skip to the next item is produces the message "Operation Prohibited By Disc."  This is unforgivable.

Say what you will about Jay Ward's cartoons, but it's all been said before. Yes, the animation wasn't the greatest, but to me they were just plain funny. I appreciate them more as an adult than I did as a child because I understand the jokes which makes them funnier. I loved them as a child and I still love them. So go ahead and just laugh, laugh, laugh. You'll feel so much better.

I remembered Fractured Fairy Tales from my youth and wanted to share them with my kids (age 12 and 10).  They loved them as much as I did (and still do).  There are 15 episodes and of course the trademark openings (Bullwinkle with wings, the gnome and the fairy).  If you want a bit of nostaglia (and some good laughs), it's worth the money.

I just received this DVD from Amazon and watched it right away.  I don't know what other reviewers are saying about the previews on this disc.  I just fast-forwarded to the menu and skipped the commercials, no problem.  I like that you can choose to play one specific cartoon or select to play all.
The cartoons are just like I remember them, including the intro and ending to each one.  I really enjoyed going back in time with one of the main reasons I watched Rocky & Bullwinkle at all.

I almost threw the DVD out it had some sort of kids advertisement, as if this collection had anything to do with brood. Someone doing the packaging evidently did not view the product. Wait there is more you can not fast forward; you can not go to the main menu; your and not pause. You just can not do anything but turn the sound off on the set and go to the fridge while waiting.

If you are lucking and have a DVD riper and copier you can fix the problem.

Once you finally get to view the disk it is worth your time. The 15 fairy tails are in blocs of five. Finally you get the fairy tale as it was meant to be unabridged and unvarnished.
Rapunzel
- The Brave Little Tailor
- Rumpelstiltskin
- Cinderella
- Snow White
- Sleeping Beauty
- Pinocchio
- Ridinghoods Anonymous
- The Ugly Duckling
- Cinderella Returns
- Rumpelstiltskin Returns
- Leaping Beauty
- The Enchanted Frog
- The Pied Piper
- The Magic Fish

An added plus id the narration by Edward Everett Horton. You may remember him from "Lost Horizon" (1837)

I leave you with this though "stay wood"- Gephetto.

In Honor of June Foray's passing, I watched this again this morning. I hadn't popped it in for a very long time. I remember loving these when I watched Rocky and Bullwinkle, and it was always such fun.  These tales never get old, and are a pleasure to see again and again!
From my era, who doesnt like a good cartoon.
Love these vintage cartoons. UPA influence was a great contribution to animation. This is one of my favorites. Dry quirky humor and hilarious characters.
Some of the goofiest animation you will find ... and it's very funny.
GREAT!
My grand nephew loved this movie!
My 5 y.o. loves these old cartoons
I got these for my grandsons to enjoy.  I think it will catch their sense of humor. just right
Always good for the heart and a good laugh.
